title: Here’s what Android 16 will bring to your phone and tablet

text: Google has just rolled out Android 16 Baklava, bringing major upgrades to smartphones and tablets across the ecosystem. The update introduces intelligent notifications, enhanced accessibility features, and productivity tools that transform how we interact with our devices. With deployment starting on June 10, 2025, this represents the earliest major Android release in recent years. Android 16's revolutionary notification system The latest Android iteration transforms how we receive and manage notifications. Real-time delivery updates now appear directly in your notification panel, eliminating the need to check food delivery or rideshare apps constantly. This intelligent system provides continuous status updates without requiring you to open the application repeatedly. These live notifications seamlessly integrate with brand-specific features like Samsung's Now Bar and the Live Alerts systems on OPPO and OnePlus devices. The automatic notification grouping feature consolidates alerts from the same application, significantly reducing clutter and information overload that often plagues notification centers. This organizational improvement creates a more focused digital experience for users who are juggling multiple applications simultaneously by prioritizing what matters most. The system adapts to usage patterns, ensuring critical alerts remain visible while less important ones are properly categorized. Accessibility enhancements for hearing aid users Android 16 makes substantial improvements for users with hearing aids. Previously, LE Audio hearing aids relied solely on their built-in microphones, which were optimized to capture external voices rather than the user's own. The new audio input selection feature allows seamless switching to the phone's microphone during calls, dramatically improving voice clarity even in noisy environments. The update introduces native hearing aid controls directly within the Android interface. Users can now adjust volume levels and other hearing aid settings directly from their phones without switching between different applications or control systems. This integration creates a more unified experience and removes previously complicated device management barriers for those with hearing assistance needs. Google has worked closely with hearing aid manufacturers to ensure compatibility across major brands and models. Security features at your fingertips Android 16 brings Google's advanced protection suite to the forefront with single-gesture activation. This comprehensive security package shields your device from: Malicious online attacks Harmful applications Dangerous websites Fraudulent calls Phishing attempts With one simple motion, users can activate multiple security protocols simultaneously, creating a robust defense against emerging digital threats without navigating complex settings menus. Desktop-like experience on tablets and large screens Working closely with Samsung, Google has developed a revolutionary “desktop windowing” system for Android 16. This feature transcends traditional split-screen functionality by enabling users to open, resize, and reposition multiple application windows on a single screen, mimicking the desktop computer experience. This significant productivity enhancement will roll out to compatible devices later this year, alongside customizable keyboard shortcuts and an improved taskbar overflow system that provides visual access to applications when the taskbar reaches capacity. Future updates will extend functionality even further, allowing users to connect their Android devices to external displays for a complete desktop experience. These innovations position Android tablets as legitimate productivity alternatives to traditional laptops for many workflows. Device compatibility and update timeline Android 16 began rolling out on June 10, 2025, marking an unusually early release for a major Android update. As expected, Google Pixel devices receive priority access, with other manufacturers following in the coming weeks and months. Compatible Pixel devices include: Pixel 6 series through Pixel 9 series Pixel 6a through Pixel 9a Pixel Fold and Pixel 9 Pro Fold Pixel Tablet Major manufacturers, including Samsung, HONOR, OnePlus, OPPO, and Xiaomi, will offer Android 16 beta versions on select flagship devices. Installation procedures vary by manufacturer, so users should consult brand-specific websites for detailed instructions. Devices not receiving Android 16 will continue functioning normally, though users should consider installing mobile security software if security updates are no longer available. To check for updates on Pixel devices, navigate to Settings > System > Software Update > System Update > Check for Updates, then select Download and Install when available. Android 16 represents a significant evolution in Google's mobile operating system, balancing new features with meaningful improvements to accessibility and productivity. The update demonstrates Google's commitment to creating a more inclusive and efficient digital experience across the Android ecosystem.

Google has just rolled out Android 16 Baklava, bringing major upgrades to smartphones and tablets across the ecosystem. The update introduces intelligent notifications, enhanced accessibility features, and productivity tools that transform how we interact with our devices. With deployment starting on June 10, 2025, this represents the earliest major Android release in recent years.

Android 16's revolutionary notification system

The latest Android iteration transforms how we receive and manage notifications. Real-time delivery updates now appear directly in your notification panel, eliminating the need to check food delivery or rideshare apps constantly. This intelligent system provides continuous status updates without requiring you to open the application repeatedly.

These live notifications seamlessly integrate with brand-specific features like Samsung's Now Bar and the Live Alerts systems on OPPO and OnePlus devices. The automatic notification grouping feature consolidates alerts from the same application, significantly reducing clutter and information overload that often plagues notification centers.

This organizational improvement creates a more focused digital experience for users who are juggling multiple applications simultaneously by prioritizing what matters most. The system adapts to usage patterns, ensuring critical alerts remain visible while less important ones are properly categorized.

Accessibility enhancements for hearing aid users

Android 16 makes substantial improvements for users with hearing aids. Previously, LE Audio hearing aids relied solely on their built-in microphones, which were optimized to capture external voices rather than the user's own. The new audio input selection feature allows seamless switching to the phone's microphone during calls, dramatically improving voice clarity even in noisy environments.

The update introduces native hearing aid controls directly within the Android interface. Users can now adjust volume levels and other hearing aid settings directly from their phones without switching between different applications or control systems.

This integration creates a more unified experience and removes previously complicated device management barriers for those with hearing assistance needs. Google has worked closely with hearing aid manufacturers to ensure compatibility across major brands and models.

Security features at your fingertips

Android 16 brings Google's advanced protection suite to the forefront with single-gesture activation. This comprehensive security package shields your device from:

  • Malicious online attacks
  • Harmful applications
  • Dangerous websites
  • Fraudulent calls
  • Phishing attempts

With one simple motion, users can activate multiple security protocols simultaneously, creating a robust defense against emerging digital threats without navigating complex settings menus.

Desktop-like experience on tablets and large screens

Working closely with Samsung, Google has developed a revolutionary “desktop windowing” system for Android 16. This feature transcends traditional split-screen functionality by enabling users to open, resize, and reposition multiple application windows on a single screen, mimicking the desktop computer experience.

This significant productivity enhancement will roll out to compatible devices later this year, alongside customizable keyboard shortcuts and an improved taskbar overflow system that provides visual access to applications when the taskbar reaches capacity.

Future updates will extend functionality even further, allowing users to connect their Android devices to external displays for a complete desktop experience. These innovations position Android tablets as legitimate productivity alternatives to traditional laptops for many workflows.

Device compatibility and update timeline

Android 16 began rolling out on June 10, 2025, marking an unusually early release for a major Android update. As expected, Google Pixel devices receive priority access, with other manufacturers following in the coming weeks and months.

Compatible Pixel devices include:

  1. Pixel 6 series through Pixel 9 series
  2. Pixel 6a through Pixel 9a
  3. Pixel Fold and Pixel 9 Pro Fold
  4. Pixel Tablet

Major manufacturers, including Samsung, HONOR, OnePlus, OPPO, and Xiaomi, will offer Android 16 beta versions on select flagship devices. Installation procedures vary by manufacturer, so users should consult brand-specific websites for detailed instructions.

Devices not receiving Android 16 will continue functioning normally, though users should consider installing mobile security software if security updates are no longer available. To check for updates on Pixel devices, navigate to Settings > System > Software Update > System Update > Check for Updates, then select Download and Install when available.

Android 16 represents a significant evolution in Google's mobile operating system, balancing new features with meaningful improvements to accessibility and productivity. The update demonstrates Google's commitment to creating a more inclusive and efficient digital experience across the Android ecosystem.
